items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.67mAOD at 04:15 on 19/04/22 and 4.70mAOD at 16:30 on 19/04/22.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 29 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 18:00 on 19/04/22, or as the situation changes.

Monday evening's tide at 09:00 PM is higher than normal due to high spring tides and strong winds (Westerly Force 4 winds).
Areas most at risk include the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir.
No property flooding is expected.
Flooding is possible at the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir from 08:30 PM on 18/04/2022. The wind strength is forecast to reduce for Tuesday morning's high tide.
The detailed tidal information for those who use it is for a peak level at Hinkley Point of 6.32 m AOD at 09:30 PM on 18/04/2022 (mAODN is height above average sea level - for more info refer to local tide tables).
We will continue to monitor the forecast, during this set of high spring tides, and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated or removed by 10:00 AM on 19/04/2022, or as the situation changes.
